description: Lists the patch baselines in your Amazon Web Services account.

parameters.name: Filters
parameters.description: Each element in the array is a structure containing a key-value pair. Supported keys for DescribePatchBaselines include the following: NAME_PREFIX Sample values: AWS- | My- OWNER Sample values: AWS | Self OPERATING_SYSTEM Sample values: AMAZON_LINUX | SUSE | WINDOWS (dict) --- Defines a filter used in Patch Manager APIs. Supported filter keys depend on the API operation that includes the filter. Patch Manager API operations that use PatchOrchestratorFilter include the following: DescribeAvailablePatches DescribeInstancePatches DescribePatchBaselines DescribePatchGroups Key (string) --- The key for the filter. Values (list) --- The value for the filter. (string) ---

nested_items.name: BaselineId
nested_items.description: The ID of the patch baseline.

nested_items.name: BaselineName
nested_items.description: The name of the patch baseline.

nested_items.name: OperatingSystem
nested_items.description: Defines the operating system the patch baseline applies to. The default value is WINDOWS.

nested_items.name: BaselineDescription
nested_items.description: The description of the patch baseline.

nested_items.name: DefaultBaseline
nested_items.description: Indicates whether this is the default baseline. Amazon Web Services Systems Manager supports creating multiple default patch baselines. For example, you can create a default patch baseline for each operating system.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: The token to use when requesting the next set of items. If there are no additional items to return, the string is empty.
